body.p: The xsl:template is the basic element for stylesheets transformation. This view is only available during XSLT debugging sessions and shows all xsl:template instructions used by the transformation. By seeing the number of hits for each of the templates you get an idea of the stylesheet coverage by template rules with respect to the input source.
The contextual menu contains one action: Go to, which moves the selection in the editor panel to the line containing the XSLT template that is displayed on the selected line from the view.

row.entry: The match attribute of the xsl:template.
The number of hits for the xsl:template. Shows how many times the XSLT processor used this particular template.
The template priority as established by XSLT processor.
The mode attribute of the xsl:template.
The name attribute of the xsl:template.
The resource file where the template is located. The complete path of the resource file is available as tooltip.

body.note:
Remarks:
Clicking a record highlights that template definition inside the resource.
Saxon only shows the applied templates having at least one hit from the processor. Xalan shows all defined templates, with or without hits.
Template table values can be sorted by clicking the corresponding column header. When clicking a column header the sorting order switches between: ascending, descending, no sort.
Xalan shows also the built-in rules.
